title: Raise Monthly Electricity Bill input cap to ₹100,000 and harden manual entry validation

requirements.summary: Increase Monthly Electricity Bill slider maximum to ₹100,000 and update the displayed range labels to match.
acceptanceCriteria: In frontend/src/components/SolarCalculator.tsx, the Monthly Electricity Bill slider max is 100000.
The max range label shown next to the Monthly Electricity Bill slider displays ₹100,000 (or formatted as ₹1,00,000) instead of ₹50,000.
Dragging the Monthly Electricity Bill slider can reach 100,000 and the displayed bill value updates accordingly.

file_operations.description: Update the Monthly Electricity Bill Slider configuration to use max=100000 (was 50000) and ensure the UI min/max labels adjacent to the slider reflect the same updated maximum (formatted consistently with existing locale formatting). Keep all other calculator logic and non-bill inputs unchanged.

requirements.summary: Clamp/validate manual Monthly Electricity Bill numeric entry to [₹1,000, ₹100,000] and prevent invalid/empty input from producing NaN/Infinity in results.
acceptanceCriteria: Typing a value greater than 100,000 in the Monthly Bill number input results in the state/value being clamped to 100,000.
Typing a value lower than 1,000 results in the state/value being clamped to 1,000.
If the Monthly Bill input is cleared and then blurred/changed, the calculator returns to a valid numeric value and the results section does not display NaN/Infinity.

file_operations.description: Add a dedicated clamp/parse helper for monthlyBill (min 1000, max 100000) and apply it to both slider and manual number input updates. Ensure empty string or non-numeric values do not get committed as NaN (e.g., treat empty as min or last valid value on blur) so derived calculations never render NaN/Infinity. Add appropriate min/max attributes to the Monthly Bill numeric <Input> to match the slider bounds.
